hi and welcome you listening to the X

everywhere the message this economy

now before I get started I just want to

it looks like the central bankers they
are making their move and they're trying
to do away with cash now we heard all
about this before there were some
experiments that were done in other
countries we heard different individuals
saying let's get rid of the
hundred-dollar bill let's get rid of
this bill and it looks like the war on
cash well it's escalating right now the
payment networks they want to kill cash
and it looks like this is coming from
like Visa MasterCard where they use the
payment systems and what they want
everyone to do is they want everyone to
use credit card and debit cards they
don't want anyone to use cash now how
are they doing this well visa they have
this new offer for small merchants take
thousands of dollars from the card run
to upgrade their payment technology in
return the businesses must stop
accepting cash now the company unveiled
the initiative on Wednesday as part of a
broader effort to steer Americans away
from using paper money so we see already
that when you go into a store if they
take this offer they're gonna say sorry
you can't use cash sorry you can't use
cash
and as more and more stores do this
people will stop using cash now there
are going to be problems of course
because we still have restaurants
restaurants like using and accepting
cash and we know right now that there's
waiters and waitresses they like to
accept cash a lot of people that go into
these establishments they like to use
casual so the people are saying now with
this new chip it takes way too long to
you know have some type of transaction
before when you just swipe the card it
was much faster now it takes a very long
time and there's a lot more information
that is transferred over to track what
you're actually purchasing so we can see
at this point that they aren't making a
play for this now remember we talked
about how the central bankers how they
are trying to control the economy now
they control most of it now what they
really want to do is they want to
control everything and when I mean
everything that means they can control
everything that you do they can watch
everything that you can that you do they
don't need to spy on you because all
that data will flow right into them and
there's nothing else you can do and we
can see at this point that to move what
they want to do is move away from paper
currency and go into digital currency
now is this such a bad thing well no not
really what makes it bad is that it's
centralized from the central bank
if it's decentralized that's okay
centralization they have control over
everything that you're doing so this is
what they're trying to do now they're
looking into the blockchain technology
don't get me wrong there's many people
out there saying well the blockchain
technology it's going to free us of all
this well they're looking at it to keep
us enslaved because they're going to use
the blockchain technology within their
systems then we have the decentralized
blockchain system where they don't have
any control of this so
is going to be a battle between these
two systems and you know what the
central bank wants they don't want to
give any of this up and this is why
they're trying to maintain control now
we already know coming out of the CBO
they've looked at the entire economy and
they said listen the way things are
right now everything cannot be sustained
and everything that Trump is trying to
do well it can't be sustained because
the US debt is unsustainable right now
and we might head into some type of

hearing alarm bells all over the place
where they're flashing these warnings
now we know that the Fed they're saying

okay it's normalizing it's stabilizing
right now and they're going to unwind

Yellen well she's going to make sure as
she's unwinding the balance sheet she's
going to keep an eye on the flattening
yield curve to make sure you know it
stabilizes now of course as we know as
they continue to do all this we know
that this is going to get out of hand
because we've seen this before this is
nothing new if we go back to 2004 2005
2006 they did the same exact thing now
the economy was much much stronger back
then actual Americans were working in
the economy they were actually buying
homes they were actually spending money
today we don't see any event the economy
is a ghost economy where Americans are
sitting on the sidelines what we're
seeing in the stock market what we're
seeing in the housing market what we're
seeing around the entire country is
where the central bank has taken control
and they're the ones with hedge funds
investment companies and others they're
the ones who created this illusion
remember over a hundred million people
are sitting on the sidelines because
they can't find a job
they're looking they just can't find
work and many of these individuals which
they are counted as full-time jobs
they're working part-time jobs or maybe
two part-time jobs they're not out

any type of home this is all done by the

we see is about eight hundred and thirty
eight billion or forty percent of their
balance sheet well that belongs to

system it's falling apart in all
different areas and many financial
pundits many different financial
institutions they're out there and
they're ringing the alarm bells now
let's think about this for a second
we had the 1999 stock bubble we had the
2007 bubble and if we go back in time
remember how everyone said that it
really wasn't that big of a bubble
because stocks weren't as expenses
expensive as they've been during the
previous bubble the tech bubble we all
remember how that turned out the bubble

is way larger than that of 2007 and
arguing that the stocks are cheaper than
they were during the tech bubble
well that doesn't hold water anymore and
if we look at the chart we can see that
the sp500 price to sales ratio called
the PS ratio you can see based on this
metric 2000 bubble is a mere blip we're
now in a territory not seen since 1999
stock market bubble we're at almost at
that same exact place and if we look at
this we can see that earnings cash flow
Book value are all financial data points
that can be massaged via all different
type of gimmicks that they use and as a
result of this
the valuing stocks based on
price-to-earnings price to cashflow
price to book value can often lead to
inaccurate valuations one thing very
hard to manipulate sales sales well it's
very hard to massage that type of data
either the money came in the door or it
didn't and if the company has caught

so the fact that stocks are now trading

largest stock bubble in history tells us

this is not going to end well now to

the IMF is out there saying this might
be
a bad idea because when you start

in a little bit of different way where
Bernanke said you know we're not

well she mentioned this this tells you

I won't be around and this will be

actually these subprime securities
they're garbage

people were pointing at them saying oh

they went bankrupt they lost everything

onward how long did it take them to
